email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. Following up on our call earlier, I’m pleased to offer a freight rate of $52.50 per metric ton for the crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. The vessel we’re proposing is the MV Ocean Star, a 150,000 DWT tanker with an LOA of 280 meters. Laycan is set for October 20-25. Let me know your thoughts. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The rate seems a bit high compared to current market levels. Would you consider coming down to the low 50s, say $50.75? Also, could you confirm the vessel’s availability for the laycan? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I’ve discussed with the owner, and we can adjust the rate to $51.00 per metric ton. The MV Ocean Star is confirmed available for the laycan of October 20-25. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $51.00 sounds reasonable. Let’s proceed with that. Can you confirm the demurrage rate? Also, please send over the full charter party for review. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great to hear. The demurrage rate is set at $25,000 per day, pro rata. I’ll send over the charter party draft shortly for your review. Let me know if there’s anything else you need. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the details. The demurrage rate is acceptable. I’ll review the charter party and get back to you by end of day. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, just following up to see if you’ve had a chance to review the charter party. Let me know if there are any questions or adjustments needed. Best, Sarah
